definitions.definition: The skin shed by a snake or other reptile.
definitions.example: That is the slough of a rattler; we must be careful.

definitions.definition: Dead skin on a sore or ulcer.
definitions.example: This is the slough that came off of his skin after the burn.

definitions.definition: To slide off (like a layer of skin).
definitions.example: A week after he was burned, a layer of skin on his arm sloughed off.

definitions.definition: (Western US) To commit truancy, be absent from school without permission. (compare ditch)
definitions.example: "Dude, Kaydn and Jarom are totally sloughing today!"

definitions.definition: (Eastern United States) A type of swamp or shallow lake system, typically formed as or by the backwater of a larger waterway, similar to a bayou with trees.
definitions.example: We paddled under a canopy of trees through the slough.

definitions.definition: (Western United States) A secondary channel of a river delta, usually flushed by the tide.
A small pond, often alkaline, many but not all formed by glacial potholes.
definitions.example: Potholes or sloughs formed by a glacier’s retreat from the central plains of North America, are now known to be some of the world’s most productive ecosystems.
